Do you have an ATI card?
Then I'd go with AiGLX not XGL
(that link is for XGL)

Nvidia don't tell people how their cards work, and they don't make a free (as in open source) driver. Therefore by default a free driver needs to be used by Ubuntu, and that is called nv, but if you want 3D then you need to use nvidia's non-open source (but no cst) driver "nvidia". The noveau project is trying to reverse engineer a free 3D driver but it isn't usable yet
